results.title: Ming
results.overview: A Chinese woman's experience as a live figure model while abroad. A film by Danski Tang (California Institute of the Arts).

results.title: Life After
results.overview: While packing up her daughter's apartment, a single mother discovers startling details about her only child, which challenge her ability to process a recent loss. A film by Ria Tobaccowala (New York University Tisch School of the Arts, Kanbar Institute of Film & Television Graduate Film Program).

results.title: A View from the Window
results.overview: An immersive glimpse of a school day through the eyes of deaf children. A film by Azar Kafaei and Chris Filippone (Stanford University).

results.title: Sin Cielo
results.overview: Delia and Memo are like most teenagers; defiant, hormonal, always on their phones; except they live in one of the most dangerous neighborhoods bordering Northern Mexico - where Dollars rule and missing girls' bodies turn up mysteriously in the river or never at all. cw: abduction, sexual violence. A film by Jianna Maarten (American Film Institute).

results.title: Iron Hands
results.overview: As a 12-year-old girl prepares for her final test trying out for the traditionally all-boys Chinese youth Olympic weightlifting team, she makes an unlikely connection with the gym's reclusive groundskeeper. A film by Johnson Cheng (Columbia University).

results.title: Still Water Runs Deep
results.overview: A father must withstand his emotions and preserve his pride when his estranged son mysteriously disappears. A film by Abbesi Akhamie (New York University Tisch School of the Arts).

results.title: Scrap
results.overview: In the shadow of the global metal trade, a metal scrapper hunts the streets of Oakland searching for his day’s keep. A film by Chris Filippone (Stanford University).

results.title: Artificial
results.overview: Many hypothesize that the technological singularity will be an apocalyptic meltdown. But what if it's a social movement? A film by Nate Burke (Brown University).

results.title: Don't Mind Alice
results.overview: When Riley Marks’s elderly boss dies, her neuroses lead her to believe she is responsible for the woman’s death. A film by Maude Apatow and Olivia Rosenbloom (Northwestern University, Brown University).

results.title: Klarinet Klub
results.overview: A boy is pressured by his gynecological father into performing a cesarean section at his school's talent show. cw: blood. A film by Federico Busciglio (Chapman University - Dodge College of Film and Media Arts).

results.title: Breaking the Cycle
results.overview: A glimpse into the private life of a record-breaking Notre Dame student athlete reveals that the biggest challenges aren't overcome on the field. A film by Josephine (Indi) Jackson and Vincent Augusto (University of Notre Dame).

results.title: No Such Sunrise
results.overview: In the spring of 2017, on a small college campus, an intoxicated white man threatened multiple students of color with racial slurs and an open blade knife. cw: racially motivated violence, slurs. A film by Celle Wright, Dana Brandeis-Simon, and Laura (Jingyi) Li (Oberlin College).

results.title: The Paper Tiger
results.overview: Who is being preyed upon? A little girl ventures through an endless corridor while being stalked by a peculiar tiger. A film by Hannah S. Kim (Rhode Island School of Design).

results.title: Cry Baby
results.overview: The noise of the crying baby is very annoying. A film by Xiner Jiang (Rhode Island School of Design).

results.title: Lotus Lantern
results.overview: A peek into the wax lotus. Lotus Lantern is a tribute to the late Chinese singer Zhou Xuan, a missing link between the filmmaker’s queer identity and Chinese heritage. A film by Xingpei Shen (Rhode Island School of Design).

results.title: The Little Giraffe
results.overview: A hungry little giraffe needs the help of a friend to reach the tasty leaves at the top of the tree. A film by Anna Kamoroff (University of North Carolina School of the Arts).

results.title: Matter Out of Place
results.overview: Intimate portrait. Blurred line. Exploration of presence and absence. A film by Oona Taper (School of the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston).

results.title: Sober Octaves
results.overview: Sober Octaves explores the nuances of fighting against the status quo from the perspective of three young black men. Computer-generated interludes and live-action narratives aid the storytelling of this visual album. cw: flashing lights

results.title: Silvia in the Waves
results.overview: The course of mourning carries Silvia, a 40 years old trans woman, and her family through the waves of memory and rebirth, death and survival. cw: suicide. A film by Giovana Olmos (Concordia University).

results.title: Pause
results.overview: Third party’s word can turn the young couple’s mood. A film by Pegah Ansari (Tehran University of Art).

results.title: National Pride
results.overview: 1960. The Spain Cyclist Tour is passing by the little town of Sacristán and, with it, the winner of the France, Spain and Italy Tours, Alberto Indiana! Federico is going to be able of see his idol closely. Maybe, too closely. A film by Víctor Ruiz Junquera (Escuela de Cinematografía y del Audiovisual de la Comunidad de Madrid).

results.title: PUP
results.overview: From the age of two, cubs are forced to leave the pride by lionesses. Only the strong turn into adults. A film by Jesús Rivera Soriano (Escuela de Cinematografía y del Audiovisual de la Comunidad de Madrid).

results.title: The Little Dictator
results.overview: Professor Yossi Kleinmann is an uncharismatic history professor lecturing on political leaders in totalitarian regimes. At the 90th birthday celebration of his wife's grandmother, a Holocaust survivor, Yossi finds himself in an unexpected situation which forces him to confront history, his family and himself. A film by Nurith Cohn (Maaleh School of Television, Film and the Arts).

results.title: Schoolyard Blues
results.overview: It's John's first day at school. Unexpectedly his eleven-year-old big brother Mika shows up to follow him to assembly. But Mika has plans other than just taking John to school. Mika sees it as his mission to teach John the hard facts of the world, starting with the merciless demands of the schoolyard. A film by Maria Eriksson-Hecht (Stockholm Academy of Dramatic Arts).

results.title: Grapefruit
results.overview: Winner of IFF's 48-Hour Film Festival. An intern listens to a series of voicemails during his daily juicing process. A film by Colter Fellows, Leopold Brekke, and Kaori Yasunaga (Rhode Island School of Design).
